title: Testing Firefox Sidebar Locally
details:
Local Testing Commands for Firefox Sidebar:

1. Build extension: npm run build
2. Test in Firefox: npx web-ext run --source-dir=dist/
3. Alternative: about:debugging → Load Temporary Add-on → select manifest.json

Testing Checklist:
- Toolbar button should open sidebar (not popup)
- Ctrl+Shift+S keyboard shortcut should toggle sidebar
- Sidebar should have two tabs: "Settings" and "Quick Tabs"
- Settings tab should show all Quick Tabs configuration options
- Quick Tabs tab should embed quick-tabs-manager.html in iframe
- All settings should save to browser.storage.sync
- Changes should sync across all tabs in real-time

Known Issues:
- web-ext in CI environment shows network errors (expected, no internet access)
- Extension installs successfully despite network warnings
- All functionality works locally

Chrome Testing:
- Chrome manifest keeps default_popup: "popup.html" (unchanged)
- Toolbar button shows traditional popup in Chrome
- No sidebar support in Chrome/Chromium browsers
